intro: Lithospermum digynum, commonly known as the two-flowered rock pepper, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are opposite and have a slightly hairy texture, while its roots contain compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Lithospermum digynum is often found in open woods and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
